intro: Hedyotis elatior f. oahuensis, commonly known as the Oahu hedge nettle, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Oahu. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of tiny white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks. It is noted for its delicate appearance and is considered an endemic species, highlighting its unique ecological significance. Due to habitat loss, it is also classified as endangered, emphasizing the need for conservation efforts.
